oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: The name of the Lion not to be spoken by children. In the Katkop dialect, by Día!kwãin, from ≠kámme-an (L V.-7. 4526 and 4526, 8. 4527-4562). Another version of this warning (L V.-8. 4563-4573).
Children must never disrespect the lion or 'play with its name', or it will remember and teach them a lesson when they are adults on the hunting-ground.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The children taught to use another name for the lion
